thread.title: Swaziland's famous Cultural and Tourism event turned deadly for 38 young girls
thread.title_full: Swaziland's famous Cultural and Tourism event turned deadly for 38 young girls

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Swaziland's famous Cultural and Tourism event turned deadly for 38 young girls
text:
Swaziland's famous Cultural and Tourism event turned deadly for 38 young girls   
Aug 29, 2015 eTN   
On the way to a major cultural and tourism event, a total of 38 young girls were pronounced dead, with more than twenty others seriously injured in car crash in Swaziland, according to the Swaziland Solidarity Network (SNN). 
Umhlanga, or the Reed Dance, is Swazilandâ€™s best known cultural event which lasts for eight days and attracts annually up to 40,000 girls and young women. it's also a major tourism attraction for anyone visiting the Kingdom of Swaziland during that time. 
The 38 girls were killed in a car crash in the southern African Kingdom while they were on their way to this national traditional event. 
On Friday, dozens of young women were traveling to the royal residence to participate in the Reed Dance ceremony held annually for unmarried and child-free women when their truck collided with another vehicle. 
The activists said they were deeply saddened by the incident as the loss of lives could have been avoided if the drivers had acted in accordance with the traffic regulations. 
The group said that police and the media were barred from reporting "extensively" on the incident.
